tool.name: make prefs file
tool.command:
make_prefs_file.py -m $map_fname -o $output_fp #if str($mapping_headers_to_use): -b $mapping_headers_to_use #end if
#if str($background_color): -k $background_color #end if
#if str($monte_carlo_dists): -d $monte_carlo_dists #end if
#if str($input_taxa_file) != 'None': -i $input_taxa_file #end if
#if $ball_scale: -s $ball_scale #end if
#if str($arrow_line_color): -l $arrow_line_color #end if
#if str($arrow_head_color): -a $arrow_head_color #end if

param.label: -m/--map_fname: This is the metadata mapping file [default=None]
param.name: map_fname

param.label: -b/--mapping_headers_to_use: mapping fields to use in prefs file [default: ALL]
param.name: mapping_headers_to_use

param.label: -k/--background_color: This is the backgroundcolor to use in the plots. [default: black]
param.name: background_color

param.label: -d/--monte_carlo_dists: monte carlo distanceto use for each sample header [default: 10]
param.name: monte_carlo_dists

param.label: -i/--input_taxa_file: summarized taxa file with samplecounts by taxonomy (resulting file from summarize_taxa.py)
param.name: input_taxa_file

param.label: -s/--ball_scale: scale factor for the size of each ball in the plots [default: 1.0]
param.name: ball_scale

param.label: -l/--arrow_line_color: arrow line color forprocrustes analysis. [default: white]
param.name: arrow_line_color

param.label: -a/--arrow_head_color: arrow head color forprocrustes analysis. [default: red]
param.name: arrow_head_color

tool.help: This script generates a preferences (prefs) file, which can be passed to make_distance_histograms.py, make_2d_plots.py and make_3d_plots.py. The prefs file allows for defining the monte_carlo distance, gradient coloring of continuous values in the 2D and 3D plots, the ball size scale for all the samples and the color of the arrow and the line of the arrow for the procrustes analysis. Currently there is only one color gradient: red to blue. The result of this script is a text file, containing coloring preferences to be used by make_distance_histograms.py, make_2d_plots.py and make_3d_plots.py.
